sponsor.partnerMessage: Trailside Dental offers comprehensive dental care for patients of all ages. The team at Trailside Dental has been serving NWA for over 30 years and is dedicated to building relationships with patients and helping build confidence in their health and smile. Now accepting new patients!

posts.title: Interform's ASSEMBLY Begins With Gallery Crawl
posts.content:
Interform's inaugural fashion and art biennial ASSEMBLY kicks off this weekend with an opening ceremony at The Momentary on Jun 1 and a Gallery Crawl in Downtown Springdale on Jun 2, from 6-10p.

  • Explore fashion: The Gallery Crawl will begin at the Atelier retail pop-up at Famous Hardware and move through eight locations in Downtown Springdale, including several unique exhibitions like a cake performance, live music, and more. Tickets are $23 and include a commemorative cup and a wine pour at each venue.
  • All month long: Intended to amplify the expression of art, fashion, and community, ASSEMBLY will be a month-long immersive experience involving art installations, exhibits, retail pop-ups, and three evenings of runway shows during NWA Fashion Week.

Reserve tickets for the Gallery Crawl and NWA Fashion Week HERE.

posts.title: Rogers Historical Museum Hosts Family Day
posts.content:
The Rogers Historical Museum will host a day of food, crafts, games, and more during Family Day this Saturday, Jun 3, from 10a-2

  • Fun-filled: Enjoy family-friendly activities like face painting, Butterfly Park tours, blacksmith demonstrations, woodcarving, food trucks, crafts, a quilt show, and a model train display by the caboose in Downtown Rogers.
  • On parade: In conjunction with our current exhibit, A Parade of Apple Blossoms, there will be a Family Day parade around Downtown Rogers at 1:30p, and all kids and families are welcome to make a fun parade craft and join in the lineup.

Find more information about Rogers Historical Museum HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville's June First Friday Theme Is Art Fest
posts.content:
Bentonville's June First Friday theme is Art Fest, a celebration of creativity sure to engage all five senses on Jun 2, with events happening at the Bentonville Square from 11a-9p.

  • Creative spaces: Leatherworking, homemade soaps, instruments, painters, jewelry, henna, and more; there will be a multitude of artistic expressions to explore throughout Downtown Bentonville during this First Friday celebration. Don't forget the Schmieding Family Sensory Alley is available for those who may find First Friday overstimulating.
  • Let's get it started: Food trucks will open at 11a for lunch, and the rest of First Friday will run from 3-9p. The DJ lineup includes M. Bolez at 5p, Allen.MP3 at 6p, and headliner DJ Afrosia on stage from 7-9p.

Read more about what to expect at June First Friday HERE.

posts.title: Hark Connects Community With Summer Childcare & Jobs Opportunities
posts.topic: Sponsored by Hark at Excellerate Foundation
posts.content:
Many families and individuals experience an increased need for childcare and temporary employment opportunities throughout the summer months. Hark can connect you with local organizations that provide these needed resources.

  • Job well done: Arkansas Joblink is an easy-to-use resource where employers post open positions in our region; similarly, Careers NWA has job postings specifically for students, employees, employers, and educators.
  • Schools out: Boys & Girls Clubs across Benton County still have availability in their summer programs for children ages 6-18 at the Bentonville, Rogers, Bella Vista, and Pea Ridge locations. Also, the Rogers Activity Center accepts DHS vouchers for its 1st - 7th-grade programs.

If you aren't sure where to start or need help navigating what's right for you and your family, connect with a Hark Community Liaison who can help HERE.

posts.title: Picklemall Announces Plans For Bentonville Location
posts.content:
Picklemall, an indoor pickleball concept that reuses existing indoor mall and strip mall properties, has announced plans to open a facility in Bentonville â€” one of 50 markets where the brand plans to expand over the next two years.

  • On camera: Players can utilize the Picklemall app to schedule games, and sessions will be recorded by a camera in the facility, giving players the ability to watch and analyze their game footage in real-time on the app.
  • First serve: A specific date and location have not been set for Bentonville, but the first Picklemall will open in Tempe, Arizona this July. Other markets targeted for expansion include Minneapolis, Chicago, Milwaukee, Austin, Dallas, San Antonio, Oklahoma City, and Tulsa.

Read more on Arkansas Business HERE.
